intro: Bonjeanea incana, commonly known as the white bonjeanea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pale green, hairy stems and showy, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bonjeanea incana is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical environments.
